"how can we still talk about data privacy being important when we upload our personal information to social media platforms every day? ğŸ¤” i mean, i understand the need to protect ourselves from data misuse, but who actually controls what happens to our data once we share it online? ğŸ˜• #dataprivacy #privacy #socialmedia"

this post critically examines the notion that people still have control over their personal information in the age of social media. the author questions the idea that uploading personal data online is compatible with protecting one's privacy and highlights the lack of transparency regarding what happens to shared data. by using the hashtags #datenschutz (data privacy) and #privatsphÃ¤re (privacy), the post contributes to a broader discussion on the topic and invites others to share their opinions.
